intro: Connarus venezuelanus var. orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and parts of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
